page.title: 04Home Life Stanton-in-Peak
page.content: My sister and I leave home for school at 8.35a.m. We meet our friends and walk along School Lane together. This takes about five minutes. After school I normally play out on my roller skates. We have tea at five, then I read, sew or weave. My parents are artists. Mum's work begins after we have left for school. She goes into the studio and embroiders and paints her pictures which sell all over the world. She made the Church altar cloth (l98O) representing the Trinity. The cloth is green - the colour of Trinity with a cental arc (the heavens) and the cross outlined in gold thread representing the Light. Dad puts Mum's work together and assembles the frames. He answers the post and the telephone, and sends Mum's notelets to different parts of England and foreign countries.
